title: Will A Federal Mandate Make The Difference For Unvaccinated Americans?
description: Last week President Biden announced a six-pronged strategy to combat the newly surging pandemic — including a federal rule that all businesses with 100 or more employees must ensure their workers are vaccinated for COVID-19, or submit to weekly testing for the virus.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Will A Federal Mandate Make The Difference For Unvaccinated Americans?
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: It's clear that unvaccinated Americans need more incentive than rising case numbers and death counts. But will a federal mandate convince them?
itunes:subtitle: It's clear that unvaccinated Americans need more incentive than rising case numbers and death counts. But will a federal mandate convince them?
content:encoded: Last week President Biden announced a six-pronged strategy to combat the newly surging pandemic — including a federal rule that all businesses with 100 or more employees must ensure their workers are vaccinated for COVID-19, or submit to weekly testing for the virus.
